reviews.text: Has great connec tion with various parts of the UK like Manchester, Cornwall, Bristol, London and Wales.
Great little station, friendly and knowledgeable staff. Main office locks around 2:30 ish I think, so no loos available after that time. Otherwise, all good!

This station is operated by Great Western Railway and mainly GWR trains seem to serve there with the hourly service that operates between Taunton and Bristol Temple Meads (and beyond occasionally)

It has 2 platforms - northbound and southbound - only one way in and out via the stairs

It appears to have no lift - so not too sure what happens if you are disabled and are there when the ticket off ice is shut (check with customer services before travelling)  There is a waiting room and toilets which presumably are only open when the ticket office is open
 and use the side entrance as marked when it is clsoed

Ticket office open Monday to Saturday 0630 to 1415 and closed on Sundays (like being in the dark ages when services do operate on a Sunday)

It could do with a face lift but is function able

Tickets office staff are nice but the atmosphere of the station isn't that nice, feels more like it'll collapse in a big storm and near enough every door is closed apart from ticket office usually would like to have a little leaflet you could take to learn about the station.
In all i personally only go there a couple-few times a year but every time it feels more and more like they need a full renovation instead of trying to mask over it but nice staff.

Can be perfectly summed up in one word: Dead. Might as well be populated by zombies. The Salem's Lott of the UK. If you're feeling suicidal but you don't have the conviction to execute, I would recommend a visit. You'll be ODing in the gutter within half an hour...
